reviews.review_msg:
I really liked Luka and the course material. The papers are fair but I found the tests a bit hard. Participation exercises are at random so you must come to class. 

You will either have to develop good note taking techniques or complete notes outside of class as the slides are heavy and fast.

Be ready to come to every class. Exams are heavily based on lectures and discussions made during lectures which he doesn't add to the slides. Also, random participation that he doesn't inform about. He is awesome though, a really nice guy. Boring lectures, sucks that participation is a must. Pretty low an effort class, just 2 papers and 3 exams.

Luka is a very nice man! however, his lectures are extremely boring and also very long. He reads directly from the lecture slides. There are 2 exams, they are only short answers no multiple choice. He says they are based directly on the lecture material but ends up pulling direct quotes that you should know from the readings. The papers are fair.

Many professors here seem to believe they are teaching very unintelligent students, leading them to behave foolishly and speak/lecture 'down' to the polite adults in front of them. Lindsay lectures respectfully and is organized- treats the subject matter and students seriously. I hope other professors will consider respecting those they teach more.

Lindsay is compassionate towards students & always accessible for help. She gave asynchronous lecture videos which were succinct & interesting. Gives helpful study guides for the multiple-choice exams which were fairly difficult. Group assignments also take a lot of time. Overall, would take another class with Lindsay!
Relatively short lecture videos, clear grading criteria, very supportive, and gives study guides before exams. Would definitely take a course with this prof again.

Very organized and posts asynchronous lectures well before the synchronous class so you have plenty of time to review the material. 3 group assignments, weekly discussion questions for participation, midterm and a final. Very interesting material. Highly recommend this prof!
Dimitra is AMAZING

Laurie does a good job of keeping the class engaged via class discussions. Expect 4-6hrs of readings/week. Shes an extremely slow marker, expect little feedback. She cancels/moves office hours VERY often. Exams were fair and based off of a review sheet she expects you to complete. Very straight forward prof, if you put in the work you will do well.

Laurie is really nice but I did not really like how she returned the exam and assignment super late, which means no feedback. No feedback, means mistakes you made on the exam will carry over to other assignments and exams within the course. I would recommend this prof, but be aware that there may be a lack of feedback

This course taken with Laurie requires a lot of work for only 3 credits. However it is very enjoyable and you get to learn lots about things that can be applied in real life. The more effort you put in, the more you will get out of it. The weekly participation was tedious but it was helpful when it came to study prep.  12/10 would recommend

This was one of my favourite classes of my undergrad! However, she has high expectations! Be prepared to read AND write a lot. The weekly participation questions were not worth it (the amount of reading and writing you have to do for less than 1% of your mark).

Laurie did her best to make Canadian Healthcare system interesting. I will say that she is helpful during her office hours. That being said, I don't necessarily believe that tutorials and the weekly participation notes are worth it. If you have to take this course, it's better to take it with another prof.
If you can, don't take 305 with this prof. HUGE reading and odd marking. Don't take it with this prof, DON'T.
She is a good professor but most people judge her too soon. office hours are useful if you put an effort. The overall picture makes more sense at the end of semester.  Not for lazy ppl.

I don't understand the bad reviews! Laurie is a good prof and cares about her students. You have a chance to get bonus marks on the group project aka over 100%! I will say tests are a bit tricky but if you study it's nothing impossible.

I dropped this class because she was a huge disappointment. On the very first day of class she classified people on social assistance as "dead-beats". She assigns an INSANE amount of readings and expects "proof" of work done in preparation in each tutorial. so condescending and juvenile.

she's been my worst experience in health science department! her assignments are extremely unclear! she doesnt teach anything during class.  she never hands back your grades and assignments but tells you that she will assign 0 to students who are "even 1 minute late". shes never helpful when you seek help from her during office hr. AVOID! SRSLY!
End of August and no grade reported. Worst prof ever, doesn't hand anything back or keep her word on anything

Be prepared for a ton of reading, useless labs and a lot of frustration! Does not hand back assignments, last day of class and no one has any grades so far to know how their doing. Assignments are extremely difficult, marks extremely hard and almost sets you up to fail. By far, hands down the absolute worst prof I have ever had, AVOID!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

So the last day of class was yesterday, & we have yet to receive a SINGLE MARK back yet. We know 0% of our grade and our take home final is due in 7 days with NO feedback or marks to go on. Expect 12+ hours of reading a week, useless tutorials and vague assignment instructions. Midterm paper had too much criteria to meet for a miniscule word count.

Worst prof I have had at SFU, never hands assignments back, does not stick to anything she says she will do yet deducts marks if your assignment is a minute late. Horribly vague despite her pages of instructions for assignments. My biggest regret was not paying more attention to her reviews on here! Awful, horrible at teaching and condescending

Laurie is very unconfident in her teaching abilities and this comes across in her demanding, condescending and vague teachings and assignments. Demands a lot from students but does not give anything back or reward those who put in the effort. Heavy course load on a very interesting subject but she seems to suck the fun and interest out.
AVOID! disorganized and not helpful at all! her class and her method of teaching were terrible. do not take this class with her unless you have to

Wow,Unbelievable!Hard marker,unreal expectations, vague assignments-the worst prof.She is knowledgeable,but does not know how to teach. She has been lying to students about grades. Its Sept29th & grades are not up from the summer class.expects us to hand stuff in on time and gives 0 if even 1 min late,but apparently shes allowed to be 2 months late

A lot of reading!!! High expectations on assignments with vague instructions. May pick on students to answer questions during lecture. Hard marker, very opinionated, strict on punctuality for assignments but doesn't follow through with returning marks.  The final paper was due Aug.16 its almost Oct and still no marks. She doesn't keep office hrs.

THE worst prof ever.She was so unbiased in marking,hasnt even returned our grades yet its been more than 1 month since our course ended.Laurie is knowledgeable but does not know how to teach or deal with students.VERY disorganized. VAGUE assignments.High expectations for no reason. This course should have been very interesting but was ruined by her

This course was disorganized and instructions were vague. Prof is strict about late assignments (zero if handed in even 10 min late), which is understandable, but our marks were handed back late or not at all. Took this course in the summer, it's September and I haven't received my grade for the course because it was submitted late by the prof.

Wow. Just wow. This was a bad prof teaching an interesting course. She was inconsistent with her marking. I rarely go on rate my prof to do this, but she is BAD. She's the type of prof that knows a lot but cannot teach if their life depended on it. Avoid her at all costs.
Instructions for assignments are vague. Assigns them way too late. Marks hard.
good

The syllabus says the average WILL be a B/B+ turns out to be a B-, I emailed her about this and said that "low outliers" explained the average being a B-. Don't promise something in a syllabus if it isn't true. The average for the final was low 60s. All the lectures is her umming and uhhing reading off the slides, yet participation is required

Her class is long and boring since she just read her slides directly for three hours. Be ready to read a lot of readings and watch many videos she only asks for one or two of those in her exam. Midterm is harder than the final exam and doing well in those papers is the key way to be successful in this class since it counts >30% of the course

Very uninspired, reads unoriginal and reused lecture slides for 3 hours straight. I understand policy is dry in itself, but there is little attempt to sound lively. Way too many weekly readings and videos.

LOTS of readings and videos to watch. exams are based on all of the required readings and videos plus the weekly lecture slides which is a lot of content to cover. select all that apply mcs made exam harder that it is. not the worst but wouldn't take her again.

She gives a lot of readings but is clear which sections are important for exams. She is very helpful and accessible as well as understanding about assignment difficulties if you contacted her. Her exams are fair as long as you do the readings. It was also open book which helped. Multiple choices are tough due select all that apply.

Lauren Currie was an incredibly lazy professor, reading directly from slides that were obviously reused semester after semester. Classes were online, and absolutely no attempt was made to try to engage the class. She had an expectation for students to work for 14 hours a week outside of lectures on this class. She IS as bad as students here claim.

Professor Currie's voice was very monotone and boring. The examinations went well, but they were rushed. The books and homework were many despite the course's interest. She expected to watch many videos and read articles before each session. Also, she didn't respond to emails.

Dr. Currie isn't as bad as she's been made out to be. She explains ideas well and goes through lectures at a fair speed. There's alot of assigned readings/videos but if you have a light course load then this should be doable. Course content is boring but that's not her fault, this course' dedicated to the Canadian health system which isn't riveting

if you want a prof who never answers emails and doesnt care about her students, this is the prof for you. LOTS of readings and long videos every week, long lectures, but the assignments were manageable. Very inaccessible and unorganized. Other than that, class was okay, content was uninteresting

Laurens not as bad as others make her out to be but there are a LOT of readings and long vids every week. Takes forever to post the recorded lectures, making it hard to stay caught up if u have to miss a class. The midterm was fair if you read and studied. Long paper (10 pages), weekly participation, and long lectures. TA's are super nice n helpful

Professor Currie was ok, but lectures were super heavy and having them be via zoom was not optimal because she goes so fast through them you barely have time to keep up, and the way she speaks is very monotone and uninteresting. The exams were ok but very rushed for time. The course was interesting but the readings and assignments were abundant.
She is not a bad professor, just gives a lot of readings. She is very helpful and easily accessible. Her exams are super fair and easy as long as you do the readings!

Lot of required readings in this class, but they are super helpful for further understanding the lecture material. Although her slides are very text heavy, she does a good job going through them. Exams were fair, but was not a fan of her multiple choice, which were select all that apply. Overall, Lauren is very nice prof, would recommend.

Course content can be dry at times and there's A LOT. However, if you keep up, study, and do practice questions you'll do okay. Also having an interest in this topic definitely makes the class easier.

exams are unreasonable, select-all-that-apply for multiple choice exams without partial marks. 3 papers, a midterm, and a final! not to mention the amount of papers and videos you are supposed to read/watch each week (at least 30 hours a week). she literally reads from the slides and sounds so unimpressed. her fav word is um so get ready to hear it

avoid her at all costs. 30 hours of required readings each week that go far too in-depth for what she teaches. abysmal lectures that lack critical information needed for exams. says um 50 times per minute. difficult midterm and final. 3 large papers. an overall horrible professor that shows no sympathy for her students.
Probably the most boring lecturer Ive met throughout my entire degree. Doesnt even pretend to try and enjoy any of the content.

The reading is too much, the tests are open book but so long. She literally reads off the slides word by word... if I wanted an audio book about the health care system, I wouldve bought one instead. From the famous words of tiktok youre done. Youre done.

Dry 3 hour lectures, says "um" a lot, unfair standards for exams where she has "select all that apply" multiple choice questions with no partial marks (it's either you get the point for picking the correct choices or receive a 0 for picking one less/more correct option). Note taking is also impossible because she zooms through text-heavy slides.

It would be useful to take this course from someone who has more experience working in the health system, but Tarya does a fairly good job with explaining things clearly. Readings are essential, but this is (in my opinion) an extremely important course for HSCI undergrads to take, so it is worth the effort.

This class has a lot of readings! Personally, I found the material to be boring and dry; has nothing to do with her as a prof. She's a good instructor. Just be prepared to put a lot of work into this class, if you want to do well. It's not an "easy A" type of class.
Great prof!! Keep up with your readings and you will be fine. Tests are very fair. She's there to help students.
Great prof. Really understands the students and tries to really help. Exams are fair and marking is fair for the most part.

Dr. Breau was an amazing professor. Her exams were based only on her notes, no tricky questions, and she had some group projects from which you could get easy marks from. Anyone that is complaining about her just lacks proper studying skills, honestly I skipped most of the time and only came for exams and iclickers but still got an A.

Took HSCI 305 with her and did well in the class, but would not take a class with her again. I didn't learn anything from going to lectures and only went because of participation marks. She packs a lot of information into her lecture slides and doesn't seem interested in class content when teaching. I learnt way more from reviewing material myself

honestly, she's not the worst professor students can have but certainly not the best. her class is fairly easy going with 3 *group* assignments making up 45% of your grade. she has the most dense, word-filled slides and basically reads word for word off it. her voice is like scissors to ears so if you have a high tolerance, you'll be okay.

Her lecture slides are really filled with a lot of useless information that wont be testing on the exam or final. The group assignment has unclear instructions and the TAs and prof has differing opinions on what they want from us. She uses iclicker to keep students coming to lecture but this class is basically something you learn on your own.

Yo this class still gives me mad ptsd even though i took it over the summer. Easier to just learn the material on your own than to force your ears to go through that torture. Scales so crazy a lizard would be jealous.

Likes to put essays on her slides and then picks minute details to ask you about on the MT/final. Just imagine a phone dial tone going off for three hours and its about a third of what her actual lectures are like. Her insecurity about her credentials will lead to her calling you out for not referring to her as "Dr. Breau" with emails. Just don't.

Please for the love of god do not take this class. asks you to memorize exact dates when she said she would not. Her lectures are really boring and it really is as bad as everyone says it is. I regret not dropping out the first week.
The course material was very dense, however, Dr Breau doesn't make it any easier with her monotone voice. The assignments fair, but make sure to study hard for the exams!
she is not as bad as previous ratings. Genevieve is willing to help and has informative slides.

One of the best classes I've taken in university thus far. She's a tough marker, and you need to do thorough research to get a good grade. A lot of readings! But I guarantee you will definitely learn something in this class. Highly recommend Dr. Palmer!!
Really nice professor. The topic is boring but Karen tires hard to make it interesting. There are a lot of readings and papers but the final is open book which is great!

She's one of my fav profs now. She's clear what she wants in the assignments, and you can always feel free to ask her after class if you want clarification. She is very knowledgeable about what she's teaching, so it gets interesting when there's discussions in class. If you wanna do well in this class, work hard, and you'll be rewarded for it =)

I really appreciated the fact we worked hard and she had high expectations of us. Lots of reading, but very interesting material. If you're on her good side, she'll really support you. If not, she'll let you know!

karen is a great prof i really enjoyed this class. She knows her stuff and has a strong opinions, readily available for extra help.  Her assignments are fair, need to do a lot of research.  A LOT OF READINGS!! find ppl to split them up with and you'll be fine for the final exam! i would def recommend taking this class with Karen

Your success at SFU is really dependent on whether a prof is great or not.... I am not sure why so many individuals have decided to give Lavergne a high grade when her assignments are nothing like the content provided. Additionally, she takes pride in making our averages low and marks tough like its no tomorrow. She is going to kill my CGPA.

Dr. Lavergne is one of the best professors I've had. Her class was interesting and engaging and she was clear about what she expected from her students. I would take another class with her if I could.

Dr. Lavergne is the best. She's a very educated prof who really cares about her students' understanding and education. She pushed back our paper due dates twice because we all had midterms around then. The material of the class can sometimes be dry but she tries her best. Definitely take this class with her if you can.

Dr. Lavergne was an amazing professor who was very skilled at making very dry content interesting. After all, as a HSCI major, an entire course dedicated to the Canadian healthcare system is extremely important, but can be difficult to teach engagingly. Her marking criteria was fantastic, and she was extremely accessible and friendly.

Ruth is one of the most engaging profs I've had over 4 years at SFU. HSCI 305 a class based almost entirely on policy, so don't expect anything too exciting. If this class is not a pre-rec, I would not recommend taking it. That said, Ruth is very clear with her explanations and what she expects you to know for exams. Study and you'll do well

Ruth is very passionate and definitely enjoys teaching students about the course topic. The term paper has several checkpoints, which were pretty much completion marks. She also provides study guides for the midterm and the final, so students know what to study on. Very much enjoyed her class.
